top_categories.workout_context: Carpathian Gravel rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Carpathian Gravel when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Carpathian Gravel’s carpathian mountains, mountainous gravel demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing Carpathian Gravel isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Carpathian Gravel. Make this intensity feel like home.
Carpathian Gravel’s carpathian mountainous gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Carpathian Gravel’s 5,500ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
Carpathian Gravel’s carpathian mountainous gravel drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
Low-cadence force work builds the muscular strength for Carpathian Gravel’s 5,500ft of climbing — especially the grinding, low-speed ascents.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Carpathian Gravel — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Carpathian Gravel — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on carpathian mountainous gravel.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for Carpathian Gravel — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Carpathian Gravel’s 65 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Carpathian Gravel. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Carpathian Gravel requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on carpathian mountainous gravel to build confidence. Expect: carpathian mountains, mountainous gravel, regional event.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Over Under, and Gravel Specific to prepare you for 65 miles of carpathian mountainous gravel in Carpathian Mountains, Romania.
